page.title: 02Local History of Hoo.
page.content: {Important events}in Hoo were the arrival of water,the sewage system and of the fire service.{The Union {Workhouse}was to do with the Poor Law. In 1845 the workhouses were united,so Hoo workhouse was for all the peninsula. The remains of it are behind the Freemasons hall. It was there from 1836 to 1936. When the{Poor {Law} changed it was used for Dr.wall'S surgery and council offices. In the early 1900's there were 1400 people in the parish,in 1971 7700 and in 1981 8100.{Farming}is and was the main industry in Hoo. In Hoo there used to be brickworks, and boat building. Now there is work in the power stations and making fibre glass. The landscape has not changed much since 1905 except for the disappearence of Elms in Hoo. The cause Dutch Elm disease which came here in the 1960's.Hoo has had floods.
